calmingmanatee:

[Image description: A photograph of a manatee floating just above the sea bottom, facing something to the left of the camera. Text: âPlease donât feel silly because you are hurting. It hurts because it was important. It hurts because it mattered.â]

I think, my human friends, that sometimes you get angry with yourself for being hurt. Because you feel like you arenât allowed to be hurting, because what made you hurt might be something not worth being upset over, or because you feel like other people have it worse.

But thatâs not true. If you are hurting, then it means that it was important. That it mattered to you. And that is a legitimate reason to feel hurt. You are allowed to feel what you are feeling.

My phrasing here has been borrowed from the lovely and talented John Green, from this video. He is a very nice man who writes nice books, and has a knack for saying things well. I hope he doesnât mind me using his words for a little while!

Too true.
